title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The Biden administration is offering to buy oil at fixed future prices to refill the nation's emergency petroleum reserve, but oil companies are wary of boosting output.

China's GDP expanded by 3.9% in the third quarter as the country bounced back modestly from crippling Covid lockdowns in the spring.

The Nasdaq has quietly halted listings of small-cap Chinese companies after a series of meteoric run-ups and dramatic collapses in IPOs this year.

Upstart e-commerce service Meesho is winning more new shoppers in India than Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart, posing a challenge to the U.S. retailing titans.

Rising U.S. interest rates and the surging dollar are creating problems for riskier companies in Asia that had flocked to the U.S. dollar-denominated bond market when yields were much lower.

Died: Dietrich Mateschitz, Austrian entrepreneur who made Red Bull energy drink a global sensation, 78.

What's News: Business & Finance
